Abstract: This literature synthesis explores the multilevel determinants of digital health equity, integrating insights from social determinants of health and health technology. The review identifies key factors at individual, community, and systemic levels that influence access to and effectiveness of digital health interventions. Findings highlight disparities in digital literacy, internet access, and socioeconomic status as critical barriers to equitable digital health outcomes. The synthesis also underscores the need for tailored interventions and policy frameworks to address these disparities, ensuring that digital health innovations benefit all populations. Recommendations for future research and practice are provided to advance the field and promote health equity.
